intro: Sunaptea scaphifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf sunaptea, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or alpine habitats. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes other aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. Sunaptea scaphifolia is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens with suitable growing conditions.
